item.title: Rubbush bin plus, 7th January
item.description:
The bibs in Butt's Wood have not been emptied dibce before xmas, the cushion dumped in fito was there before I went on holiday over xmas, there us also a black sack by another bin, bern there same amount if time !! No picker has been since well before xmas as some paper on grass more up the pathway towards exit to galliobs reach health center, still there from 22 dec when I walked my dog past. This park area seems to get forgotten, but students from both schools use thus area to get to bus stop , cut throughs, they live to dump stuff in canal, there's a trolly there now, no doubt next week it will also be in the canal! Bags of dog poo in bags sitting on top of bins, as they are full.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Butts Wood Path, Thamesmead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti 'oops' on electric box, 7th January
item.description:
More 'oops' graffiti has been done on the electric box outside property 17. Please can I ask the council to remove this. Also if they can check all down the street and clean other tags too. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Anerley Park, Crystal Palace, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Junk in canal, 7th January
item.description:
This area has gradually got worse, tge students threw all sorts in the canal, it's full of wood that was cut by peabody, lots of glass bottles, cans, and now metal barrier left by the guts who tarmac the pathway, there's a green bike in there too. Nobody seems to care about this area or the wildlife that live here. Irs a disgrace. Trees over grown, weeds all growing tall around the canal and the seating area. There's another green bike up on the grass area, where the barrier was, but now in the water.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Butts Wood Path, Thamesmead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road markings warn out, 7th January

item.title: Drain/access cover on pavement caved in, dangerous, 7th January
item.description:

item.title: This place is always full of rubbish and it's never ending, 7th January
item.description:
People keep throwing the rubbish here for many many years now and no measures have been taken by the council. You can't educate some people ,but at least you can prevent it by at least installing a CCTV or some announcement boards with the information. It is disgusting to walk near here and even dangerous for peope,as someone left a big broken glass and mirror. Please take some actions as this is getting worse and worse and can not be avoided anymore.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Newmarsh Road, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Burst water pipe, 7th January
item.description:
There is a burst pipe on the street which causes flooding in the bus stop outside out house. The pavement is also very slippery due to icing which is very dangerous, especially for elderly and parents with children etc
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Maberley Road, South Norwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
